title: What subjects or technologies do the media constantly portray incorrectly? - Quora

response.answer_text: If, by “the media”, you include TV, the ease of “pinging” a cellphone to find out its exact location. Or the way you can get something’s location from its GPS. It’s fiction. The carrier might be able to locate a cellphone by the towers it’s hitting, but that would be a rough location. And GPS? That’s a receiver, it doesn't transmit anything. Even if you tell it to (although I don’t see how you would - it’s not set up to “receive commands”). And the ease with which a “hacker” gets past a password. Most of mine are 50 character randomly generated strings of letters, numbers and punctuation marks. How does anyone guess that in 5 tries? Only on TV.
